ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write an extensive report on research
I learned a lot about the process of creating a study.
This course has given me the opportunity to conduct individual empirical research. Ive been able to investigate a specific research question and analyze data to get meaningful results.
I learned how to survey a field of literature.

I developed a project idea, operationalized it, developed stimuli, designed experimental tasks, and began data analysis on my thesis project. This course helped me refine my research, writing and presentation skills, learn how to collaborate with other researchers in the lab, and develop a more responsible understanding of cross-cultural psychological research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: the freedom to chose your advisor, topic, and structure of the thesis. weakness: little information was relayed to students. I felt unsure of whether there were specific guidelines for the paper, etc. The only thing we were told was the due date. I wish we would have had a major-wide meeting to discuss the thesis and what was expected of us.
It was very helpful to have such a close relationship with my advisor so that I could be guided in the best way possible.
Strengths: allows for a unique learning experience compared to usual lecture classes (conducting research)
I think it all depends on your advisor and mine was fantastic!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes it was very helpful for writing a thesis.
Yes to get a BS or interested in research.
Yes, if you need to complete your senior requirement for the BS in Psychology.
